Class DB

  • java.lang.Object
    • DB

  • public class DB
extends java.lang.Object
    This class initializes and manages the database used to store all the information in Dragon's Lair. This information is used to print the pull list.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

        csvId - The date csv file was read in. The most recent date determines new releases.

      • insertSearchTerms

        public void insertSearchTerms(java.lang.String store,
                              java.lang.String name,
                              java.lang.String diamond,
                              java.lang.String issue,
                              java.lang.String graphicNovel,
                              java.lang.String nonBook,
                              java.lang.String matches)
        Inserting into the searchTerms.
        Parameters:
        store: - The store being used.
        name: - The name of the item the customer wants (customer jargon).
        diamond: - The diamond code.
        issue: - The issue number.
        graphicNovel: - Determines if the item is a graphic novel.
        nonBook: - Determines if the item is a book.
        matches: - The actual name of the item that Dragon's Lair has.

      • allCsvToCustomer

        public java.sql.ResultSet allCsvToCustomer(java.lang.String store,
                                           java.lang.String search)
        This is case 2: When a searchTerm is All Something, we would provide "Something" as the search parameter. I think we could derive the search argument by grabbing the matches column associated with All Something if that is how the database is actually set up. There is a method called getSearchTermMatch which returns the match name given a searchTerm id.
        Parameters:
        store: - The store the database is associated with.
        search: - The search string we use to associate the csvEntries corresponding to an All Something.
